conclusion: Consider forces acting on the rod and induced EMF due to motion in magnetic field.
Gravitational force acts downward and is given by F_g = mg.
Magnetic force acts upward due to interaction of current in rod with magnetic field.
Induced EMF is given by E = B l v.
Length l is the distance between rails AB and CD.
Resistance of rod MN is R = r l.
Current induced in the rod is I = B v / r.
Magnetic force on the rod is F_B = B^2 l^2 v / r.
At constant speed, gravitational force is balanced by magnetic force: mg = B^2 l^2 v / r.
Solve for velocity v: v = mgr / B^2 l^2.
Final velocity of conductor rod MN is v = mgr / B^2 l^2.
